name: Afterlife Empire
description: Hey, you just died. But don't worry! All the major religions were wrong! Instead of ascending to a new plane of existence, you are now self-employed in the Afterlife with your own haunted house to run. Keep people just scared enough to keep believing in you, but not enough to alert the local authorities.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: OpenGL Version 3.2 Storage: 400 MB available space

reviews.review_text: More Simcity Social than Theme Hospital, it's a good paced haunted house puzzle game. Playing without any technical failures on a mid-to-low level PC with outdated graphics card.
Shows promise, I think they need some more time to revise the interface, the menu could be more fleshed out. Music's okay for a bit, but I got tired pretty quickly.

This game has the potential to be a fun little way to pass the time. but at its current stage just dont bother. the controls dont work half the time, and thus far i havent been able to finish even half the tutorial before it breaks.  Edit: after a bit back and forth, i have managed to work out the controls. and while they are VERY finicky at times, i could actually enjoy and play the game, and at this point it turns out to be very fun.  rate 5/10

Pro:  -Fun and addictive, like a freemium game sans wait-gaming -Funded by Gamergate -Vivian James  Con: -Excessively high physical memory usage for god knows why -Constant crashes -A fraction of a percentage of the profits fund Feminist Frequency -Good luck getting Vivian to show up  This is by all means a fun game, but you should hold off on it. Wait a while for them to do something about the nonstop crashing, and buy it on sale to minimize Anita's cut.
is it buggy, yes, are there glitches, certainly. Is it still a lot of fun. Yes it is. my complaints are purely technical and I hope will be patched in future iterations.
Dull mobile style game with no options menu, buggy and crashes.
It's kinda buggy, but nothing game breaking. The price is great. I would say it is a decent purchase.
